senses.de: A variety of different things or activities
senses.ex: The store sells a range of organic products.

Tips.title: When Diversity Matters
Tips.description: Use 'range' to highlight the diversity within a group or collection.
Tips.example: Our club offers a range of different sports.

Tips.title: Amplitude of Options
Tips.description: 'Range' emphasizes the extent of choices or alternatives available.
Tips.example: You have a range of options for your assignment topics.

senses.de: The extent or area over which something can operate effectively
senses.ex: This car has a range of 500 miles on a full tank.

Tips.title: Effectiveness Area
Tips.description: 'Range' indicates how far something can work effectively, like a signal.
Tips.example: Your Wi-Fi signal has a limited range inside the house.

Tips.title: Limitations of Movement
Tips.description: In physical contexts, 'range' can refer to how much you can move a body part.
Tips.example: After the injury, his range of motion was reduced.

senses.de: A cooking appliance with multiple burners and usually an oven
senses.ex: She cooked dinner on the range.

Tips.title: Kitchen Essential
Tips.description: A 'range' is a common kitchen appliance for cooking, essential in many recipes.
Tips.example: Preheat the range to 375 degrees before baking the cookies.

Tips.title: Combination Appliance
Tips.description: A 'range' combines a stovetop and oven, usually positioned in one place.
Tips.example: The new kitchen features a modern gas range.

senses.de: To vary between a set of values or limits

Tips.title: Span of Values
Tips.description: Use 'range' when talking about a set of possible numbers or amounts.
Tips.example: Temperatures range between 20 and 30 degrees Celsius in spring.

senses.de: An open area for shooting practice or military exercises
senses.ex: The soldiers trained on the firing range.

Tips.title: Practice Area
Tips.description: In military or sport, a 'range' is a designated area for shooting practice.
Tips.example: Let's head to the shooting range to practice our accuracy.

senses.de: To travel or roam over a large area
senses.ex: The wolves range across the entire forest.

Tips.title: Roaming Free
Tips.description: 'Range' as a verb describes moving over a wide area without a fixed path.
Tips.example: The mustangs range freely over the plains.

Ambit.wordDefinition:
Ambit refers to the range or limit of something, such as the scope or extent of a project or authority.

It usually describes a specific area or domain of influence. For example, the ambit of a law enforcement agency might be the entire country.

Ambit refers to the limits or scope of something specific, while range refers to a broader series of possibilities.

Breadth.wordDefinition:
Breadth refers to the extent or scope of something, typically covering a wide variety of areas or topics. For example, a breadth of knowledge indicates that someone has a wide range of knowledge in different subjects.

Both words can describe the coverage or extent of something, but breadth tends to be used more for knowledge or understanding, while range is often used for physical measurements or variables.

Compass.wordDefinition:
Compass usually refers to a tool or instrument that helps someone determine the direction in which they are moving or facing, such as a magnetic or directional compass used for navigation.

In simpler terms, a compass helps you find which way you're going, while a range tells you how far you can go.

A compass is mostly used by travelers or explorers, while a range can be used in various fields such as science, transportation, or sports.

Extent.wordDefinition:
Extent refers to the size or degree of something, usually indicating how much of it there is. For example, "The extent of the damage caused by the hurricane is still being assessed.".

In simpler terms, extent refers to how much of something there is, while range refers to the different types of something that exist.

Field.wordDefinition:
Field describes an area or a region where something is happening or exists. For example, a soccer field, a field of crops, a field of study.

So, while field refers to a physical or metaphorical area where something exists or happens, range refers to the spread or variety of something.

Gamut.wordDefinition:
Gamut and Range are both words that describe a group of things that belong to a certain category.

However, the difference between these words is that Gamut refers to the complete extent or entire range of something, while Range refers to the specified limits or a limited extent.

For example, if you are describing the colors of an image, the gamut would refer to the entire range of colors that can be displayed or printed.

Gamut means the complete extent of something, while range means a limited extent or a specified limit of something.

Reach.wordDefinition:
Reach refers to the distance or extent that someone or something can physically touch or affect. For example, a person's reach might be six feet, meaning they can touch or grab something up to six feet away.

Range describes distance or capability, while reach describes physical proximity or impact.

Scale.wordDefinition:
Range and scale are both words used to describe measurements or values in a particular situation.

Scale refers to the proportion or ratio of the measurements or values in relation to the whole.

It is often used to indicate a system or method of measurement, such as a linear scale on a map or a logarithmic scale on a graph.

For example, a logarithmic scale may be used to show a wide range of values on a graph, where the distance between each point on the scale increases exponentially as the scale increases.

Range is applicable when discussing the limits or extremes of a set of data, while scale describes the size, proportion or order of these values.

Scope.wordDefinition:
Scope can refer to the extent or opportunity for something, or the influence or reach of something.

For example, the scope of a project or the scope of a company's operations.

Range describes the variety or extent of things within a specific category, while scope describes the opportunity or influence of something.

You might say that the scope of a project includes the goals, timeline, and resources needed to complete it.

Span.wordDefinition:
Span refers to the distance or length between two points or endpoints.

It can also refer to the amount of time between two events. For example, the span of a bridge might be 50 meters. Span is applicable when talking about distances, lengths, or durations.

Sweep.wordDefinition:
Sweep refers to the action of moving through an area or range. For example, a radar sweep refers to the process of scanning an area for signals or activity.

Range means the measurement of how far something can go, while sweep means the action of moving or scanning through a specific range.

Range is applicable when measuring distance or capacity, while sweep is applicable when scanning areas for signals or activity.

Variety.wordDefinition:
Variety refers to the number of different types of something. For instance, a farmer may grow a variety of crops, such as corn, wheat, and soybeans.

In this context, variety describes the diversity or assortment of a collection of items.

Range refers to the values or extent of a specific attribute, while variety pertains to the number of different types of something.

Range applies to quantitative measurements, while variety is more qualitative in nature.

videos.Text: These techniques are known as cherry picking. A time range can be carefully chosen to exclude the impact of a major event right outside it. And picking specific data points can hide important changes in between. Even when there's nothing wrong with the graph itself, leaving out relevant data can give a misleading impression.

quotes.Text: It's kind of my whole philosophy as an actor. I think that's what we're supposed to do is play a wide range of characters - or it's just what I like to do, I should say. I like to try to be as different as I can from one thing to the next.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Garret Dillahunt

quotes.Text: With 'Richard,' I was excited to make this film with such an amazing role for an actor. Play a wide range of emotion and really invest myself in the character.
quotes.Title: Irish Actor
quotes.Name: Jack Reynor

quotes.Text: Once you expose your private life, if you give one little bit, the floodgates are open and everyone's got a free range for you.
quotes.Title: British Actor
quotes.Name: Jason Statham

quotes.Text: I think that's what we're supposed to do is play a wide range of characters - or it's just what I like to do, I should say.
quotes.Name: Garrett Dillahunt

quotes.Text: It is very important for me to do different things so that people see that my range is more than just comedy.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Javed Jaffrey

quotes.Text: We need to have as broad a range as possible, because life itself has that kind of range.
quotes.Title: American Composer
quotes.Name: John Eaton

quotes.Text: I'm trying to broaden my range and get different characters in each film.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Jodi Lyn O'Keefe

quotes.Text: We all had a desire and appreciation for such a wide range of music.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: Jim Capaldi

quotes.Text: I have a very broad range of life experiences.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Gabriel E. Gomez

quotes.Text: I think the range of my life shows in my work.
quotes.Title: German Photographer
quotes.Name: Juergen Teller
